div.p:
śeka, dyaḥ hayām· vuruk·, Iniriṁ denyājñā pāduka śrī tribhuvanottuṅgarājadevī jayaviṣṇuva
rddhani, sakala-rāja-maṅgala-bhavatī-pratimaā, lalita-manohara-jñāna-pratāpa-śobhita, sārddhanāri§
śvara muAṁ pāduka bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tavarddhana, Aśeṣa-rāja-praṇipata-māṇḍitā, sacchaya muAṁ Ājñaā pā
duka śrī vijayadevī, mahārāja-rāja-śekkharādhiṣṭitānindita-vīryyalaṅkarā, sakala-guṇa-pra
vāla-buddhi-sahitā, sārddhanārīśvara muAṁ pāduka bhaṭāra śrī vijayarājasā, saṅgrama-vīryyalaṅkr̥ta,

tinaḍaḥ de rakryan mahāmantri katrīṇi, rakryan mahāmantri I hino, dyaḥ Iśvara, rakryan mahāmantri §
sirikan·, dyaḥ Ipo, rakryan mahāmantrī I halu, dyaḥ kañciṁ,

Umiṁsor i taṇḍa rakryan riṁ pakirakiran ma
kabehan·, saṅ āryya senaāpati pu tanu, saṅ āryyātmarāja pu taṇḍiṁ, rakryan· dmuṁ pu gaṣṭi, rakryan ka
nuruhan· pu turut·, rakryan· raṅga pu lurukan·, rakryan tumǝṅguṁ pu nāla, sāddhu-gopika-durjjana-vi§
nigraha-tatpara, mavastha patiḥ ri pajaṁ, samahiriṁ muAṁ rake juru paṅalasan· pu pṭul·, naya-vi
3
naya-dhara, makapramukkha saṁ mantrīṅgitājñā prajālaṅkarākāra, rake mapatiḥ pu mada, sakala-nīti-vr̥ha§
spati-saṅgrāmikā, prāṇarakṣaka śrī mahārāja pranaṇālāmratisubaddhakǝn· paṅḍiri śrī mahārājā
ṅkǝn· Iśvaraprativimba, gumavayakǝn· hitakarmmaniṁ yavadvīpamāṇḍala, muAṁ viśīrṇnaniṁ praāṁmu
khe pāduka śrī mahārāja, dharmmadhyakṣa riṁ kasevan·, saṅ āryya rājaparākrama, ḍaṅ ācā§
ryya darmmarāja, dharmmadhyakṣa riṁ kasogatan·, saṅ āryyadhirāja, daṅ ācāryya kanakamuni,
boddha-śāstra-vyākaraṇa-parisamāpta,

tlas karuhun saṁ dharmmapravakta vyavahāra-vicchedaka, saṁ pamgǝ§
t i tiruAn·, saṅ āryya vaṅśādhirāja, ḍaṅ ācāryya śivanātha, bhairavapakṣa nyaāya-vyakaraṇa-śā
stra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i kaṇḍamuhi, ḍaṅ ācāryya marmmanātha, mapañjy āṁśuman·, sorapakṣa nyāya-vya
karaṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i maṅhuri, ḍaṅ ācāryya smaranātha, bhairavapakṣa nyāya-vyaka
raṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i jāmba, ḍaṅ ācāryya jayasmara, sorapakṣa śaṅkya-śāstra-parisamā
4
pta, samgǝt i pamuAtan· ḍaṅ ācāryyāgreśvara bhairavapakṣa nyāya-vyakaraṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta,
samgǝt i kaṇḍaṅan rarai, ḍaṅ ācāryya munīndra(,) boddha-śāstra-parisamāpta,

maṁrasa-rasani saṅka ri gə:ṁniy a
dimuktinikaṁ vyavahāri kāliḥ, kupva pgat kavivakṣanya de saṁ pragvivāka matguḥ ri kapakṣadarmman·
ri daL̥m nāgara, marmmanikaṁ vyāvahari kāliḥ saccchaya mampak-āmpak· humatur i taṇḍa rakryan· riṁ
pakirakiran makabehan· mintonakǝn· pakṣanya sovaṁ-sovaṁ kunǝṁ suṅan· vara-varaḥ aki
santana, mapañji śaraṇa, muAṁ sarovaṁnya, ki karṇna, mapañji manākara, Ajaran· reka, ki siran·, ki jumput·§
Uṅsun madr̥vya lmaḥ punaṁ manah i manuk·, kayoniṁ savaḥ, Aḍavuṁ, liriḥ, 1, I beR̥m·, liriḥ, 1, I pa
jnon· kiduliṅ umaḥ, liriḥ, 2, pajnon· kubvan·, kuñci, 1, paṅeran·, kubvan·, kuñci 1 tiga thani, ka
yoniṁ savaḥ vareṁ, liriḥ, 1, kayon·, valuntas·, liriḥ, 10, tiga thāni kubvan·, kuñci, 1, dinanā
kǝn iṁ tuha-tuha mariṁ katyagan· pakaṇḍaṅan·, liriḥ, 16, mariṁ maṇḍala riṁ kukub·, liriḥ, 2, mariṁ jaṅgan iṁ pa
5
ṅle, liriḥ 1, kabhukti deniṅ amadr̥vyakǝn·, liriḥ 33, piṇḍa liriḥ 67, punika ta sthiti bhukti saṅkeṁ tu
ha-tuha, bapa, kaki buyut·, pituṁ, Aṅgas·, muniṁ, kr̥pǝk·, tan hana(ṁ) suvanda, Apan anadi kabhuktyanipun·, maka
vyakti kīrttini tuha-tuhani(ṁ) Uṅsun· bale i maṇḍala i kasḍahan·, sakakala, 919, vayuhanǝṅaḥ ra
kva Aranipun·, punika ta samanakāla lāvan· savaḥ, Apituvin tan hana savahipun samasānak i punaṁ sī
ma tiga, livat iṁ vatǝs· pakaṇḍaṅan·, tan punika davakta lmah i Uṁsun· tanpa tahil· tan kajnǝṅan· ta
n pinakaparanati deniṁ deśa, makahetu Anadi kābhuktyanipun·, tan· vruḥ ta Uṅsun panaṅkanipun· A
pan anadi, maṅke ta Inakunipun pasaṇḍan pun samasānak i sīma tiga, makādipun apañji Anavuṁ harṣa, kunǝṁ
suṅan· vara-varaḥ samasānak i sīma tiga, makādi saṅ apañjy anavuṁ harṣa, Uṅsun madr̥vya punaṁ lmaḥ savidak·
pituṁ liriḥ vicaravisaya, sinaṇḍakǝn i pituṅ i Uṅsun iṁ pirak kali tṅaḥ takǝr·, duk punaṁ bhumi java tanpa ga
gaman pisis· Ika taṁ pakṣa kāliḥ, pinametakǝn· śastradr̥ṣṭa, deśadr̥ṣṭa, Udāharaṇa, guru kaka,

app.note: Boechari notes Di bawah huruf ta ada tanda suku dalam guratan tipis, tapi rupanya tidak jadi dipahat..

div.p: First edited by Boechari (112 E.49); re-edited here by Marine Schoettel from the estampage of the plate made available by the Museum Nasional Indonesia.
